A 'schema-on-read' approach defines the data schema when the data is read, as opposed to 'schema-on-write' where the data schema is defined when the data is written.
A 'schema-on-read' method requires data to be cleaned before it can be stored, unlike 'schema-on-write' which cleans data during read operations.
In 'schema-on-read', data is stored in predefined fixed schemas; 'schema-on-write' allows for flexible schemas that can change over time.
A 'schema-on-read' system involves less data processing power at the time of storage, whereas 'schema-on-write' systems use more resources during storage for processing.
